title: China Announces Record Trade Surplus as Its Exports Flood World Markets
summary: China’s surplus reached $1.19 trillion last year, a 20 percent increase from 2024, as Beijing kept the currency weak and pursued self-reliance to replace imports.

title: Trump Credits ‘Mister Tariff’ for the Country’s Strength. Economists Beg to Differ.
summary: Many indicators appear to suggest that the United States is growing despite tariffs, not because of them.

title: As Trump Pushes Housing Affordability, His Mortgage Chief Undermines It
summary: Under Bill Pulte, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac have pulled away from efforts to help low-income people buy homes.

title: Prosecutors Resign Over ICE Investigation, and Israel Is Still Demolishing Gaza
summary: Plus, the battle over taxing billionaires.

title: How ICE Crackdowns Set Off a Resistance in American Cities
summary: In Minneapolis and other cities where federal agents have led immigration crackdowns, residents have formed loose networks to track and protest them.

title: Videos Show Increasingly Aggressive Federal Crackdown in Minneapolis
summary: Arrests and aggressive tactics by ICE and the Border Patrol, many seen on viral videos, have intensified the frustration and fear among residents.

title: Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey, Who Cussed Out ICE, Is No Stranger to Crisis
summary: Mayor Jacob Frey, a Democrat, has clashed with his party’s activist wing. His response to ICE has won him new respect at home and new foes in Washington.

title: ICE Arrested Dozens of Refugees in Minnesota and Sent Them to Texas, Lawyers Say
summary: The refugees, many of them from Somalia, had passed security screenings before coming to the United States. The Trump administration has vowed to “re-examine thousands of refugee cases.”

title: Trump Renews Threat on Greenland Before Meeting at White House
summary: Top officials from the U.S., Denmark and Greenland will meet for the first time since President Trump said he wanted to own Greenland.

title: ‘We’re Not Stupid’: Greenlanders Fear What a U.S. Takeover Would Mean
summary: A visit to Greenland reveals a swirl of feelings as people nervously await talks with the Trump administration about the island’s future.

title: Trump’s Threats to Greenland Raise Serious Questions for NATO
summary: The treaty that created NATO did not contemplate an attack by one ally on another. A seizure of Greenland by President Trump would test the endurance of the mutual-defense pact.

title: U.S. Refiners to Profit as Trump Asserts Control Over Venezuelan Oil
summary: The companies that turn oil into gasoline and diesel are likely to benefit more, right away, than the businesses that pump oil out of the ground.

title: Venezuela Announced the Release of Political Prisoners. Families Are Still Waiting.
summary: Hundreds of families are hoping their loved ones will be freed by the Venezuelan government, which has said little about who would be released or when.

title: Jodie Foster: An American Oscar-Winner in Paris
summary: In “A Private Life,” the actress takes on her first solo lead role in which she speaks fluent French, but her French connection goes all the way back to childhood.

title: Initial Review Finds No Widespread Illegal Voting by Migrants, Puncturing a Trump Claim
summary: Republican election officials welcome the review, which relies on a federal verification tool, but they say they have not discovered a major problem when it comes to noncitizen voters.

title: Trump Raises Middle Finger at Heckler in Michigan Ford Factory Tour
summary: A White House spokesman said the president “gave an appropriate and unambiguous response.”

title: Senator Says Prosecutors Are Investigating Her After Video About Illegal Orders
summary: It is unclear what possible crime might involve Senator Elissa Slotkin, a Democrat, who has warned in dire terms about the dissolution of American democracy.

title: Saks Files for Bankruptcy as Department Stores Fight for Survival
summary: The parent company of Saks, Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman struggled with debt, designers and customers in recent years.

title: What the Bankruptcy of Saks Means for You
summary: Answers to this and other questions about the financial crisis in America’s biggest luxury department store.

title: Where Did All the American-Born Roofers Go?
summary: The real story of how immigrant labor came to define the construction industry.

title: Iran’s Leaders May Survive Protests. But Anger Will Likely Persist.
summary: Its security forces have brutally defended the Islamic Republic, but the protests show that many Iranians consider it stagnant and ideologically hollow.

title: A Timeline of Protests in Iran
summary: Amid a near-total communications blackout, witness footage trickling out of Iran paints a picture of how the country’s largest uprising in decades spread — and turned deadly.

title: Chuck Schumer Calls His Shot
summary: After securing strong recruits on a tough Senate map, the Democratic leader is not only predicting an upset 2026 victory, but also naming the states he thinks his party can flip.

title: Mark Carney Heads to Beijing to Discuss Canada-China Relations as U.S. Outlook Darkens
summary: The prime minister is seeking new markets for Canadian goods and to mend relations with China after years of deep acrimony between the two nations.

title: China’s Coal Ban Improved Air Quality, but Villagers Are Paying the Price
summary: China banned the burning of coal for heat around Beijing, but natural gas subsidies have run out, leaving many villagers vulnerable in dangerously cold weather.

title: Trial to Begin for N.Y.P.D. Sergeant Who Threw Cooler at Fleeing Man
summary: Erik Duran, who fatally struck the man, Eric Duprey, as he fled on a motorbike in 2023, faces charges of manslaughter, assault and criminally negligent homicide.

title: Extreme Weather Events Hit Around the World in 2025
summary: Last year was Earth’s third hottest globally, but temperature is just one measure of climate change’s influence.

title: Trump Has Stopped Pretending That This Is All Normal
summary: The president’s assertion of unlimited authority is a total rejection of popular sovereignty and the logic of the Constitution.

title: Minneapolis’s Limit
summary: We look at how the actions of federal agents in Minneapolis are impacting life in the city.

title: Stephen Colbert Accuses Trump of ‘Invading Minnesota’
summary: “Has anyone told him that they don’t have oil?” Colbert said of the president’s plan to send 1,000 more immigration officers to Minnesota.

title: Crane Falls on Passenger Train in Thailand, Killing at Least 31
summary: The authorities said there were almost 200 people aboard when the accident happened northeast of Bangkok. Dozens were injured.

title: Jimmy Carter, the Man From Plains, Had a Passion for Painting
summary: Amy Carter, the daughter of former president Jimmy Carter, selected paintings and memorabilia for two Christie’s sales. The prices might surprise you.

title: Playing Catch on an L.A. Sidewalk? You May (Technically) Risk Jail Time.
summary: A little-known and rarely enforced law prohibits ball games on some Los Angeles streets and sidewalks. The local council has begun the process of repealing it.

title: Paraglider Survives 500-Foot Crash Into Ocean Off Florida, Rescuers Say
summary: A bystander captured the misadventure in a video that drew widespread attention online. Lifeguards and a snorkeler helped rescue the man.
